answer_html: \(\int _2^\infty \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}=\frac{1}{100\ln(2)^{100}}.\) This implies that the series converges absolutely by the integral test.
answer_latex: $\int _2^\infty \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}=\frac{1}{100\ln(2)^{100}}.$ This implies that the series converges absolutely by the integral test.
question: 4 (c)
sols_html:
We will use the integral test. Note that

\[\begin{aligned} \int_2^\infty \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}=\lim_{a\to \infty} \int_2^a \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}\end{aligned}\]

We can calculate \(\int_2^a \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}\) by substitution with \(u=\ln x\) (then du=(1/x)dx) to get

\[\begin{aligned} \int_2^a \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}} &= \int_{\ln(2)}^{\ln(a)} u^{-101}du \\ &= \left.-\frac1{100u^{100}}\right|_{\ln(2)}^{\ln(a)} \\ &= -\frac1{100}\left(\frac1{(\ln(a))^{100}}-\frac1{(\ln(2))^{100}}\right) \end{aligned}\]

Hence

\[\begin{aligned} \int _2^\infty \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}=\lim_{a\to \infty} \frac1{100}\left(\frac{1}{\ln(2)^{100}}-\frac{1}{\ln(a)^{100}}\right)=\frac{1}{100\ln(2)^{100}}.\end{aligned}\]

This implies that the series converges absolutely by the integral test.
sols_raw:
We will use the integral test. Note that 

:<math>
\int_2^\infty \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}=\lim_{a\to \infty} \int_2^a \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}
</math>

We can calculate <math> \int_2^a \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}} </math> by substitution with <math>u=\ln x </math> (then ''du=(1/x)dx'') to get 

:<math>
\begin{align}
\int_2^a \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}} &= \int_{\ln(2)}^{\ln(a)} u^{-101}du \\
&= \left.-\frac1{100u^{100}}\right|_{\ln(2)}^{\ln(a)} \\
&= -\frac1{100}\left(\frac1{(\ln(a))^{100}}-\frac1{(\ln(2))^{100}}\right) 
\end{align}
</math>

Hence

:<math>\int _2^\infty \frac{dx}{x\ln(x)^{101}}=\lim_{a\to \infty} \frac1{100}\left(\frac{1}{\ln(2)^{100}}-\frac{1}{\ln(a)^{100}}\right)=\frac{1}{100\ln(2)^{100}}</math>.


This implies that the series converges absolutely by the integral test.
statement_html:
Determine, with explanation, whether the series

\[\begin{aligned} \sum_{n=2}^{\infty}\frac{(-1)^{n}}{n(\ln n)^{101}}\end{aligned}\]

converges absolutely, converges conditionally, or diverges.
statement_raw:
Determine, with explanation, whether the series 

:<math>
\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}\frac{(-1)^{n}}{n(\ln n)^{101}}
</math>

converges absolutely, converges conditionally, or diverges.
